container-title: Her major publications include Debate and Dialogue: Alain Chartier in His Cultural Context; Chartier in Europe, with Ashby Kinch; Manuscripts and Printed Books in Europe 1350–1550: Packaging, Presentation and Consumption, with Susan Powell; and A Companion to Alain Chartier c. 1385–1430
note: The Father of French Eloquence, with Daisy Delogu and Joan E. McRae. Contributors · 299
title: Emma Cayley (DPhil Oxon) is head of the Department of Modern Languages and associate professor of medieval French at the University of Exeter, UK, where she has taught since 2003. She teaches and publishes in the area of late-medieval French poetry and culture, and her research interests extend across the digital humanities; manuscript studies and the history of the book; text-editing; and gender studies
